item.title: History Marches Past Davos
item.description:
[Geopolitical]

Geopolitically Significant

Selected by: Batch1-Run1, Batch1-Run2

The World Economic Forum meeting in Davos will feature the usual pledges about stakeholder capitalism, purpose-driven business, and sustainable development. But without binding conditionalities, accountability frameworks, and risk-sharing that distinguish genuine value creators from rent extractors, it remains theater.

item.title: Is There Life After the Dollar?
item.description:
[Geopolitical]

Geopolitically Significant

Selected by: Batch1-Run1, Batch1-Run2, Batch1-Run3

Global financial stability has long depended on the dollar’s role as the main reserve currency, with the expectation that the United States would both set the rules and uphold them. As American leadership grows more erratic, that dependence has become a vulnerability, underscoring the need for a multicurrency system.

[Geopolitical]

Geopolitically Significant

Selected by: Batch1-Run1, Batch1-Run2, Batch1-Run3

Everyone, not least Europe, now confronts behavior that was already familiar to many across the Global South.

[Geopolitical]

Geopolitically Significant
